intro: Wahlenbergia gracilis var. stricta, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves are adapted to its arid environment. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
